Class PersonalGoalReader

JSONFileReader
public class PersonalGoalReader extends Object implements JSONFileReader
Reads personal goal cards data from json files

  • Constructor Details

    • PersonalGoalReader

      public PersonalGoalReader()
      Contracts a new JSON file reader

  • Method Details

    • getPersonalGoalsData

      public HashMap<Color,Point> getPersonalGoalsData(String fileName) throws IOException, org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
      Reads a JSON file from the resources/data/personal_cards/ folder given its name, if the file exists in the directory the method returns a hashmap containing the color-coordinates pair for each objective
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the JSON file that need to be read
      Returns:
      a map containing the coordinates of each objective, by colour
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file does not exist or, for any other reason cannot be opened for reading
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - if an incorrect JSON is being parsed

    • getPointStack

      public Stack<Integer> getPointStack() throws IOException, org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
      Reads the resources/data/personal_cards/points.json file to get how many points the player gets for completing each objective. The amount of points received is based on the number of objectives already completed (this data is set while writing the points.json file)
      Returns:
      a stack containing the points that is player is going to get for completing each objective
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file does not exist or, for any other reason cannot be opened for reading
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - if an incorrect JSON is being parsed
